entry.title: Re: Issue eDocument Cockpit Greece - MyData
entry.content:
Hello @Annika98 ,

This message indicates that your XML is out of sequence or structurally invalid according to the MyDATA schema. Specifically, the <invoice> element contains <invoiceSummary> too early, while the schema expects <invoiceDetails> first.

In MyDATA v1.x schema, the correct structure inside <invoice> is:
<invoiceHeader>
<invoiceDetails> (one or more)
<invoiceSummary>
If these elements appear out of that order, validation fails.

Verify that your generated XML strictly follows the schema order:
<invoiceHeader> (header data)
<invoiceDetails> (line item data)
<invoiceSummary> (totals, VAT breakdown, etc.)
Make sure all required <invoiceDetails> lines are present before <invoiceSummary>.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Oracle on Linux Refresh Procedure
entry.content:
Hello,

Recently our systems migrated from Windows to Linux.
Our database backups are configured in networker tool. Both our application and database are on different servers.
Our concern, after OS migration we have been requested from the client to perform system refresh.
For that we are targeting our sandbox system i.e. we need to refresh our sandbox system with the production data.

Problem we are facing : 
We don't have any system refresh procedure for the Linux operating system.
We are not sure just by moving only .anf file (backup file) from source to the target system  will perform restore.
We would like to know from you what could be the refresh procedure and what will be the files we need to move from source to the target.

Note : We want to perform the restore with brtool option.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Oracle on Linux Refresh Procedure
entry.content:
Hi,

Truth is that this is the most important moment to create your restore routine for a disaster recovery scenario.

There is no "one size fits all" when it comes to restoring a database, so we cannot provide you with a guide for that purpose, but I can certainly give you some overall instructions to help you build your own procedure.

Things you should have clear:

  • Is your backup going to tape, disk or anything else?
  • Are backup files accessible in the sandbox server? 
  • How have your backup been performed?

With that in hand, you can start the planning, having these steps in mind:

  1. Make sure all your backup files are available in the sandbox (not only the backup log)
  2. Make sure your sandbox has the OS, Oracle and BR*Tools installed in the very same version and settings as the production system
  3. Make sure the init<SID>.sap file is also copied to the sandbox
  4. Based on your backup (log is your friend), configure brrecover/brrestore commands with reference to https://help.sap.com/doc/saphelp_nw73ehp1/7.31.19/en-US/46/bafec999701515e10000000a114a6b/frameset.htm
  5. Refer to note 605062
  6. A very basic command line would be: brrestore -u // -b <backup_log_name>

Don't be afraid to fail, make sure to have some restore points for the whole server and test it. It is the best way to optimize the procedure that suits your organization the better. 

Cheers,

Thiago

entry.title: SAP Developer News July 31st, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/07/31/%f0%9f%94%94sap-developer-news-july-31st-2025/ 

SAP Integration Suite updates 

  • SAP Integration Suite – Update Version of an Integration Flow Component: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-integration-suite-update-version-of-an-integration-flow-component/ba-p/14158284 
  • The E in Event-Driven Architecture: Introducing SAP’s new Event-Add for ERP: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/the-e-in-event-driven-architecture-introducing-sap-s-new-event-add-for-erp/ba-p/14160285 
  • Unlocking the Power of Events: A Deep Dive into the Event Add-on for ERP: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/unlocking-the-power-of-events-a-deep-dive-into-the-event-add-on-for-erp/ba-p/14167261 
  • Queue Browser: Deep Message Visibility for Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/queue-browser-deep-message-visibility-for-event-mesh-in-sap-integration/ba-p/14159563 

The new Terraform Provider for SAP Cloud Connector (beta release) 

  • Announcement https://www.linkedin.com/posts/christian-lechner-inthecloud_already-automating-your-sap-btp-infrastructure-activity-7355533613737607169-sQa2 
  • Registry entry https://registry.terraform.io/providers/SAP/scc/latest 
  • Repository https://github.com/SAP/terraform-provider-scc  

Awesome-cap repository on GitHub 

  • https://github.com/mauriciolauffer/awesome-cap 

Return of the SAP Community Voice newsletter 

  • First edition https://community.sap.com/t5/what-s-new/the-return-of-sap-community-voice/ba-p/14166197  

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 SAP Integration Suite updates 

1:56 The new Terraform Provider for SAP Cloud Connector (beta release) 

2:49 awesome-cap repository on GitHub 

3:22 Return of the SAP Community Voice newsletter 

 

TRANSCRIPTION 

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for July the 31st, 2025.

[Antonio] Hola, SAP developers. There is a new feature in the latest release of SAP Cloud Integration that I'm sure you'll be very excited about. It is now possible to easily update the version of an integration flow component. Previously, updating the version of a component was done manually. For example, you wanted to update the version of an adapter, meant reconfiguring it from scratch. This was quite painful and error-prone. The new feature enables a one-click update to update a component which is backward-compatible to the latest version without any loss of the existing properties, configurations, or externalized parameters. Cool, right? Check out Kamlesh's blog post to learn more about the new feature. In the event-driven space, have you heard about SAP's new event add-on for ERP? You can leverage the add-on to event-enable your SAP on-premise backends, for example, SAP S/4HANA or SAP ERP, and expose consume events to and from SAP Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh. Check out Carsten's blog post series to learn more about it. Also, there is a new feature in the event mesh capability of SAP Integration Suite. It is called Queue Browser, and it will allow you to inspect and visualize messages in a queue via the web UI without consuming the messages from the queue. It is quite powerful as you can examine the message metadata, for example, headers, statuses, and errors, and troubleshoot maybe a more-formed payload in the message. Check out Arley's blog posts for more information. Ciao!

[DJ] You've probably heard of the Terraform Provider for SAP BTP, which allows you to create and manage your resources on BTP declaratively using an open standard. Well, the Terraform team have just released the beta of the Terraform Provider for SAP Cloud Connector. This essential piece of connectivity software in your SAP landscapes is now able to be managed declaratively, just like your assets on BTP. What's not to like? Check it out. It's a beta, and the team would love you to try it out, kick the tires, and send them thoughts on what you think. Links in the description.

[Kevin] So if you were wondering what kind of awesome tools libraries and sources for CAP are out there look no further Mauricio Lauffer got you he has this brand new repository on github which is a list of all of those things and that list is awesome and the repository is called awesome cap so check it out right now and maybe also contribute your awesome links to the repository today.

[DJ] remember the SAP community voice  online email based newsletter well it's back online but this time in the form of blog posts on the SAP community platform in case you don't know this newsletter highlights interesting blog posts community news events and lots more check it out the first edition in blog post form is from our Jerry, Jerry Jander link in the description.
